availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Dewitt C. Miller (Adair County, Kentucky, blacksmith and pvt 3rd Ky Inf USA)

body.p: Adair County, Kentucky, blacksmith and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Parthena Beard Miller in Adair County, Kentucky, on March 11, 1834. Father of M. F. Miller, J. M. Miller, O. A. Miller, M. L. Miller, and D. W. Miller. Blacksmith in Adair County in 1850. Served in the 3rd Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as private from October 1, 1861, to February 1, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, District 1, p. 32B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Adair County Marriages, Film #000469187, p. 51 of 603 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 174.
Find A Grave, "D.C. Miller (1809-1886)," Memorial #77857520, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/77857520 (accessed July 6, 2020).
